titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the William Addison Paisley papers, 1919-1976 MS1003.UA
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-18 11:52:18 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: This collection includes photocopies of correspondence and newspaper clippings bound in book form, related to the career of William Paisley, GW Law School (LL.B 1924) and Department of Justice attorney. They range in date from 1919-1976.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: William Addison Paisley papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the University Archives by Elizabeth Dargan in 2001.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Addison Paisley (c.1897-19xx) was an attorney for the Department of Justice and graduate of The George Washington University Law School in 1924. He was born in Pulaski, Tennessee. From 1913-17 he worked as a stenographer and accountant for the Southern Express Company in Mississippi, Alabama, and Tennessee. From 1917-18 he was a stenographer with the War Department in Washington and New York. During World War I, he served from 1918-19 aboard the USS Mexican, a cargo transport ship. He began his government career in 1919 with the Bureau of Internal Revenue, and continued his education by going to night school at the Washington School of Accountancy, where he prepared himself to enter law school at GW (where he was a member of the Columbian Debating Society).

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes photocopies of correspondence and newspaper clippings bound in book form, related to the career of William Paisley, GW Law School (LL.B 1924) and Department of Justice attorney. They range in date from 1919-76, and were donated to the University Archives by Elizabeth Dargan in 2001.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is unprocessed and no series have been determined.
